byline.original: By EZRA KAPLAN and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr

lead_paragraph: Both mothers had the Zika virus during pregnancy, but Colombian health officials said overall cases of the mosquito-borne virus were decreasing there.

headline.print_headline: In Colombia, Zika Is Cited in 2 Births
headline.main: Colombia Confirms More Birth Defects Linked to Zika

snippet: Both mothers had the Zika virus during pregnancy, but Colombian health officials said overall cases of the mosquito-borne virus were decreasing there.
abstract: Colombian officials confirm two more cases of babies born with brain damage to mothers infected with Zika virus during pregnancy, bringing total number of cases to four; officials say, however, that Zika is declining across country.
